ontA.path: C:\Users\A177889\OneDrive - Atos\HarmonicSS\datasets\Step 4 OAT\New 6\Apache-Tomcat-with-OAT\.\ONTO\20190920075345709-UNEW 2019-04-18 Metadata FINAL_queries resolved-ANNO-ANNO.xlsx.owl
ontA.label: Cohort (Metadata)
ontA.comment: An ontological representation of the Cohort parameters. The ontology has been automatically generated based on the uploaded Excel Document with Cohort Metadata (extracted on Date: 2018-09-27). This document has been also automatically generated based on the data recorded about 1302 patients. For each patient, there are 206 Fields (Parameters aka Properties), the value of which often come from one out of 164 different controlled Set of Terms. Metadata extracted have been revised by technical experts (in close collaboration with clinical experts).
ontA.creator: Institute of Communications and Computer Systems of National Technical University of Athens - ICCS/NTUA

ontB.label: HarmonicSS - Reference Model and Vocabularies
ontB.comment:
This ontology specifies the parameters of particular interest for the diagnosis, control and/or treatment of patients associated with the primary Sjogren Syndrome (pSS). 

The design of the ontology was driven by the documents with the minimum and maximum pSS parameters (D.4.1 revised) prepared by the Clinical Partners participating in the HarmonicSS project.

Provides the appropriate Term (i.e., Sex) based on Value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules already specified.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Field and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term and unit of measurement - both current and desirable). Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified, the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case no Unit of Measurement specified in the Reference Model about the specific Lab Test, no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Term (i.e., BMI category) based on Value of the given Fields (i.e., Weight and Height) taking into account additional data provided (i.e., Format of Number and Units of Measurement).
Provides the values of the parameters specified in the right side taking into account the patient data in the given fields as well as additional parameters provided.

Provides a List of Entities with the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition) based on the value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., mapping of cohort Medical Condition Terms/Values with the corresponding Reference Model terms about Medical Conditions). If the value of this Field is empty or none of the comma separated terms are aligned with the Reference Model Medical Condition terms, no data will be recorded.
Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition), provided that the value existing in the 1st field indicates that the person has received the specific Drug.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test (i.e., Schirmer's Test Worst Eye Value) and whether its outcome was Normal or not, based on the Values of the given Fields (i.e., values recorded for both Left and Right eyes) and the additional parameters provided (i.e., numbers format and normal range of values). In case both 1st and 2nd Fields are empty or their values are not valid numbers, no data will be recorded.

Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Drug) provided that the value existing in the given Field is not empty. More precisely, IF the value is yes (i.e., aligned with the YES confirmation term) the service indicates that the person has received that drug, otherwise not.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Fields and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term, multiplier and Unit of Measurement). Also, provided that the UNL and/or DNL have been specified (expressed in the given Unit of Measurement) the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case the 1st Field is empty no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Fields and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term, multiplier and Unit of Measurement). Also, provided that the UNL and/or DNL have been specified (expressed in the given Unit of Measurement) the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case the 1st Field is empty no data will be recorded.

In case the 1st Field is empty no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Field and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term and unit of measurement - both current and desirable). Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified, the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case no Unit of Measurement specified in the Reference Model about the specific Lab Test, no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Field and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term and unit of measurement - both current and desirable). Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified, the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not.
